author: Samantha Chery
title: Katy Perry, Gayle King to head to space on all-women Blue Origin flight
text:
A six-women crew including pop star Katy Perry and journalist Gayle King will embark on a trip out of this world in the spring, Blue Origin announced Thursday.
Skip to end of carousel
click here. To subscribe to the Style Memo newsletter,
click here.
King also announced her involvement in the trip while co-hosting “CBS Mornings” on Thursday, complete with a movie-trailer-esque video.
“This was never my dream. It was never my dream,” King said. “And somebody said, ‘Maybe you need to have new dreams, Gayle.’ … I don’t know how to explain being terrified and excited at the same time.”
The broadcast journalist said she was offered a spot on the trip around Thanksgiving this past year and decided to accept after getting approval from her best friend, Oprah Winfrey, and two kids, Kirby Bumpus and Will Bumpus Jr.
The crew is rounded out by Lauren Sánchez, Bezos’s fiancée and the trip’s leader; Aisha Bowe, a Bahamian American aerospace engineer; Amanda Nguyen, a civil rights activist set to be the first Vietnamese woman to travel to space; and Kerianne Flynn, a film producer known for independent movies “Lilly” (2024), “The Automatic Hate” (2015) and “This Changes Everything” (2018).
Blue Origin didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.
The New Shepard rocket and spacecraft had traveled to space more than a dozen times without people on board by the time Blue Origin began taking passengers.
Bezos; his younger brother, Mark Bezos; aviator Wally Funk; and Oliver Daemen, who became the youngest space traveler ever, were in the inaugural cohort launched into space in 2021. Since then, the company has flown 52 people into space, including Star Trek actor William Shatner, Shepard’s daughter Laura Shepard Churchley, and television personality and former NFL star Michael Strahan.
The spacecraft can carry up to six people to an altitude of more than 60 miles, where they experience a few minutes of weightlessness and view Earth from above the atmosphere. It was temporarily grounded by the Federal Aviation Administration due to an engine failure during an uncrewed launch in 2022, but it was redesigned and resumed flights a little over a year later.
The company, based just outside Seattle, has set its sights on expanding space tourism, which Jeff Bezos, a lifelong space enthusiast, has said is “the most important work I’m doing.”
This month, the company announced plans to lay off 10 percent of its workforce, cutting the jobs to compete with Elon Musk’s SpaceX.
Christian Davenport contributed to this report.

author: AWP
title: Rekord bei Homeoffice-Stellen - Schweiz trotzt Gegentrend | MarketScreener Deutschland
text:
Zürich (awp) - In der Schweiz bieten immer mehr Arbeitgeber Homeoffice an. Damit schlagen sie eine andere Richtung ein als die Konkurrenz im Ausland.
Das Angebot an Homeoffice-Jobs erreichte hierzulande im zweiten Quartal 2025 einen neuen Höchststand, wie eine Auswertung der Jobplattform Indeed zeigt. Konkret lag der Anteil solcher Stellen per Ende des ersten Halbjahres bei gut 14 Prozent.
"Damit hat sich das Angebot an flexiblen Jobs seit der Zeit vor der Pandemie mehr als verfünffacht", heisst es in dem am Freitag veröffentlichten Bericht. Die Schweiz festige damit ihre Position als Standort für flexible Arbeit in Europa.
Denn in vielen westlichen Ländern rufen die Unternehmen ihre Mitarbeitenden gerade wieder ins Büro. Oft wird als Grund eine höhere Effizienz genannt.
Schweiz auf Platz 3
Mit dem relativ hohen Anteil an ortsunabhängiger Arbeit von 14 Prozent liegt die Schweiz im Vergleich mit den grössten westlichen Volkswirtschaften nur knapp hinter dem Vereinigten Königreich und Deutschland. Kanada liegt im selben Rahmen wie die Schweiz, danach folgen Frankreich und die USA.
"Gelingt es den Unternehmen, diesen Weg weiterzugehen, kann sich die Schweiz langfristig als führender Standort für flexible Arbeitsmodelle in Europa etablieren", kommentiert Virginia Sondergeld, Arbeitsmarktexpertin bei Indeed, den Bericht.
Auf der Jobseite Indeed sind über 610 Millionen Menschen aus mehr als 60 Ländern registriert, um nach neuen Stellen zu suchen.
ls/jb
© AWP - 2025

author: creator
title: More air defense systems and means of destruction of Russian aviation bring peace closer – address by the President of Ukraine
text:
Dear Ukrainians!
A few important things for this day and these weeks.
First of all, our defenders of the sky.
I would like to recognize all Ukrainian warriors who defend our sky every day and night. Only this Sunday night they managed to shoot down 35 "Shahed" drones. In total, since the beginning of March, Russian terrorists have already used 175 such killer drones against Ukraine. Fortunately, 151 of them were shot down by our warriors. And this is a very important result. Yes, not all of them. Yes, there are hits. Unfortunately, there are losses. There are casualties. But there are also people saved.
I am grateful to every warrior of our mobile firing groups in all regions of combat duty. I am grateful to every pilot and engineer of the Air Force, to all our air defense warriors. We will further enhance our firepower and Ukrainian air defense. More air defense systems and other means of destruction of Russian aviation bring peace closer. I am grateful to everyone in the world who helps us with this. Ukraine will have more air defense systems – we are working very hard on this.
Second. Our Defense Forces consist of many elements. Many brigades and units. And everyone who serves at the front, everyone who defends the state from Russian saboteurs and terror, everyone who performs combat missions deserves gratitude and respect. Russian murderers and torturers are not moving further into Europe only because they are being held back by Ukrainians with weapons in their hands and under the blue and yellow flag. In Ukraine, there were many once-white walls of houses and churches that are now scorched and ruined by Russian shells. And this speaks very eloquently about who has to stop for the war to end.
Anyone who protects life and people fulfills the most honorable possible mission amid such an inhuman invasion. And we must fully protect life in our home. And I thank everyone who supports our defense, Ukrainian defenders.
When the Russian evil started this war on February 24, all Ukrainians stood up for defense. Christians, Muslims, Jews – everyone. I thank every Ukrainian chaplain who is with the army, in the Defense Forces. They are on the frontline, protecting life and humanity, supporting with prayer, conversation, and deeds. This is what the church is – it is together with people, not two and a half thousand kilometers away somewhere, virtually mediating between someone who wants to live and someone who wants to destroy you. I thank everyone who is doing everything in Ukraine and with Ukraine to save lives, I thank everyone who is helping and who is really with us through actions and prayers.
Today I would like to recognize the servicemen of our National Guard who are fighting alongside everyone else on the frontline in the east and south of Ukraine. The warriors of the 3rd operational brigade – Junior Sergeant Viktor Ivanov and Lieutenant Kyrylo Kudinov. The 5th Slobozhanska Brigade of the National Guard – soldiers Serhiy Turilkin and Mykola Hnatyuk. I would also like to recognize the warriors of the 1st and 3rd assault squads of the Omega Special Forces Center of the National Guard. Thank you for your skills and the results Ukraine needs.
Also, following these weeks, we have reasons for gratitude to the servicemen of the Defense Intelligence of Ukraine – the details should not be disclosed publicly now, but the enemy definitely feels their work. And the more the Russian state loses, the sooner all this evil of war will disappear from our land.
Today I spoke with French President Macron. The conversation lasted more than an hour. I am grateful to Emmanuel for his new initiatives in support of Ukraine, for his leadership, which gives all of us in Europe strength. I am grateful for the new defense package. We discussed the schedule and key expected results of our upcoming meeting in Ukraine.
One more thing. The holy month of Ramadan is now beginning for Muslims in Ukraine and around the world. And this year, unfortunately, Ramadan is overshadowed by ongoing war and suffering. May this month bring us all closer to a fair and just peace. Not only for Ukraine. But for all the nations that are suffering from war. Humanity is capable of achieving a level of unity where justice protects life from wars.
I am grateful to everyone who helps Ukraine and Ukrainians! I am grateful to everyone who defends life and justice!
Ramadan Mubarak! Glory to Ukraine!

author: TF1 INFO
title: Les images impressionnantes des orages qui ont balayé l'est et le nord de la France
text: Dans l'est de la France, les orages de ce jeudi ont été particulièrement violents.Dans certaines communes, il est tombé l'équivalent d'un mois de pluie en moins de quatre heures.Dans les Vosges, notamment, l'eau est montée jusqu'à deux mètres dans le secteur de Dompaire. C'est du jamais vu de mémoire d'habitant. Dans la commune de Dompaire, dans les Vosges, [la violence du torrent a emporté la route](/meteo/intemperies-previsions-meteo-france-orages-inondations-a-evreux-la-violence-du-torrent-a-fait-eclater-le-bitume-2311390.html) et creusé un nid de poule géant, qui a englouti une voiture. Comme dans 25 autres communes du département, une crue éclair a tout dévasté sur son passage, et dans certaines maisons, l'eau est montée jusqu'à 1,50 mètre. Une violence qui a marqué les riverains. "Ça a été hyper rapide et hyper violent", raconte une résidente dans le reportage en tête de cet article. Si la montée des eaux a été rapide et violente, aucun blessé n'est à déplorer. Selon [Météo-France](https://vigilance.meteofrance.fr/fr), il est tombé, entre Épinal et Vittel, plus de 100 mm d'eau, provoquant des dégâts conséquences. Dans la commune de Damas-et-Bettegney, tout a été emporté. Dans une ferme, [si les chevaux ont pu être sauvés](/meteo/video-orages-previsions-meteo-france-violentes-intemperies-dans-le-nord-quand-les-pompiers-tentent-de-sauver-un-troupeau-de-brebis-en-detresse-2311469.html), les poules, elles, ont été emportées par la violence du torrent. "Il n'y a plus rien, tout est foutu", témoigne, très émue, une habitante qui tente de sauver les jouets de ses enfants. Des maisons envahies de boue, une voiture échouée dans un jardin après avoir été emportée sur une centaine de mètres… Les habitants mettront des jours à nettoyer les dégâts des violentes intempéries. Lire aussi Jusqu'à 40 jours de pluie en 6 heures : les images des violents orages dans les Vosges et en Seine-et-Marne Des dégâts observés également dans le nord de la France, [frappé par de violentes intempéries](/meteo/video-intemperies-grele-previsions-meteo-france-des-routes-detruites-et-un-camping-evacue-le-nord-et-l-est-de-la-france-face-aux-violents-orages-2311402.html). À Sablonnières, en Seine-et-Marne, les habitants tentent, eux aussi, d'évacuer la boue qui a envahi leurs habitations après les orages de jeudi soir. Selon la maire, 80 maisons ont été touchées, et si les autorités ne déplorent aucune victime, un homme a dû être hospitalisé après avoir été emporté par les eaux alors qu'il tentait de rentrer chez lui. Blessé au coude, il a dû être emmené à l'hôpital. Dans le département, il est tombé entre 80 et 100 mm d'eau en quelques heures, jeudi soir : 100 mm à l'est de Coulommiers, et 50 à 80 mm entre Fontainebleau et Nemours. Météo-France maintient d'ailleurs sa vigilance orange pour crues sur le territoire. Selon les prévisions de l'organisme, des orages forts pourraient toucher, ce vendredi après-midi, le Massif central ainsi que la basse vallée du Rhône et l'est des Pyrénées.

author: Ángel Bartolomé Muñoz de Luna
title: AI still isn't making a serious impact on university education - here's why
text:
Artificial intelligence (AI) promised to revolutionise the field of education. But how, and how much, is it actually being used by students and teachers today? Our recent article sought to answer this question by analysing AI’s integration into universities from two perspectives: scientific (how it is actually being used) and social (perceptions of its use).
While researchers tend to highlight the opportunities and challenges AI presents for personalised learning, social perception tells a different story, reflecting a slower and more uneven adoption, particularly in Europe.
Personalisation, virtual tutors and admin In recent years, AI has been steadily rolled out in education , particularly in areas such as personalised learning, virtual tutors and the automation of administrative tasks.
Platforms such as Smart Sparrow, Knewton, Century Tech, and Khan Academy use AI to adapt the pace and content of learning to students’ individual needs. These systems use AI to analyse student performance (correct or incorrect answers, response time, error patterns), as well as to automatically adjust the level of difficulty, type of content or pace, and to recommend additional exercises, videos or reading.
Tutoring systems are another use. These are chatbots or virtual assistants that interact with students as a human tutor would. Their typical functions are to answer questions about content, propose exercises, give explanations, solve problems step by step, motivate and accompany the student in their progress.
Some examples are Khanmigo (Khan Academy + GPT-4), which helps with maths, writing and science, Duolingo Max, an AI for personalised language tutoring, Google’s Socratic, which answers questions with visual explanations, and Carnegie Learning’s Mika, an AI-powered maths tutor.
All of these platforms use machine learning models that recognise students’ strengths and weaknesses. This technology is already being used successfully in disciplines such as medicine, electronics and linguistics, where large-scale data analysis and automation are essential for teaching and research.
This technology also allows for the efficient management of administrative processes, such as exam correction and tracking grades and performance.
Read more: AI in universities: How large language models are transforming research
Limitations and challenges Despite the expectations surrounding AI, its impact on university education remains modest . Globally, its use in universities is still in its infancy, and AI adoption varies greatly between regions and disciplines . While significant progress has been made in some areas, such as health sciences, other areas like the humanities are only just beginning to explore the possibilities of this technology.
One of the main challenges is a lack of training for teachers and administrators in the use of AI tools. Many teachers do not have the necessary skills to integrate them into their classrooms, which limits their adoption. In addition, the lack of clear policies on student data privacy and the ethical use of this technology poses significant barriers.
Read more: AI is now part of our world. Uni graduates should know how to use it responsibly
Europe lags behind Despite being a leader in regulations on the ethical use of technology, Europe is lagging behind in terms of scientific research on how to integrate it into educational methods.
There are exceptions, including the UK, which has very solid research on the ethics of educational AI and adaptive teaching models and automatic assessment. In Germany and the Netherlands, European Union interdisciplinary projects are also combining education, cognitive sciences and computer science.
The United States leads in scientific publications, patents, and the development of educational technologies based on AI. Meanwhile in China, there has been a significant increase in publications and applications of educational AI, especially in adaptive learning and facial recognition in smart classrooms. Massive state investment in “Smart Education” is part of its strategy for leadership in AI.
Latin America (especially Brazil, Chile, and Mexico) also has a growing research output, with advances in adaptive educational platforms and learning data analysis. There is a growing interest in using this technology to reduce educational gaps, and in improving access to it in disadvantaged areas.
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Phuti Mathobela
title: 'Papa G, we had many plans together' | Daily Sun
text: LEGENDARY Darlington "Papa G" Michaels has been remembered as a loving man! The former Isidingo actor was remembered by family and industry friends as they celebrated his life at the Soweto Theatre on Thursday afternoon, 19 September. Darlington Michaels, whose real name was Teboho Ndarana, died after a short illness at the age of 78 on Friday, 13 September. Xoli Noah, the family spokesman, said he worked with Darlington for many years. He mentioned that when Darlington died, they were already working on a couple of projects under his brand. "We were planning many things together, and we lost him just like that. I don't want to lie; I'm hurt and wish he was here," he said. Xoli said Darlington was always happy to be back on his feet. Karabo Ndarana, his granddaughter, said she wanted to see her grandfather grow with her. She expressed her deep sorrow, saying she wanted him to see her success. ALSO READ: [Touching memorial for Mfundisi Ntshebe](https://www.snl24.com/dailysun/celebs/actor-and-musician-philani-aka-mfundisi-ntshebe-remembered-at-memorial-in-katlehong-20240919) "I wanted him to see me going to school and graduating. He owes me a lot as we were so close," she said. Karabo hoped he would be there for her first car and other celebrations. Jerry Tsie said the industry has lost a strong candidate who was full of life. He mentioned that Darlington always wanted to see people happy. "We are saddened by his passing and wish we could do more. We will offer the family a few cultural things just to thank them," he said. Jerry gave the family a traditional stick, mats, and a few other items. Actor Peter Sephuma said Darlington was his biggest industry friend. He mentioned that they worked on several projects together and were planning to bring more great things for TV lovers. "We were close, and we loved one another so much. I will always remember him for all the great things we had together," he said. Actress Tina Jaxa said she was touched by his death as they always communicated daily. She mentioned that she was there when he wasn't feeling well. "I was hurt as he wasn't feeling okay, and I was with him. I will always cherish the moments we had together as a family," she said. Sello Maake KaNcube described Darlington as one of the greatest performers of all time. He said he witnessed Darlington's wonderful work. "He was so brilliant and loved his work. However, he never wanted to be remembered for what he was good at and his artistic work." Darlington's funeral service will be on Saturday, 21 September. The service will be at Uncle Tom's Community Hall in Orlando, Soweto, from 9am, and his body will be laid to rest at the West Park Cemetery in Joburg. author: Redacción
title: Familia de Lefty revela VIDEOS del asesinato del rapero y acusa silencio de la Fiscalía | Radio Fórmula
text: [A casi cuatro meses del homicidio del rapero Juan Carlos Sauceda](https://www.radioformula.com.mx/espectaculos/2023/9/3/muerte-de-lefty-su-esposa-revela-detalles-del-asesinato-del-rapero-con-desgarrador-mensaje-778863.html), mejor conocido como Lefty SM, salieron a la luz unos videos que muestran el momento en el que recibió los disparos que lo mataron. Dichos videos fueron difundidos por la familia de Lefty SM, tras el silencio de la Fiscalía de Jalisco ante el crimen cometido en contra del rapero, reveló Cristian, hermano de éste, en entrevista con Mafian TV. "Decidimos sacar los videos a la luz, porque esta madre se está enfriando, ya no se está haciendo nada, la neta. Tomamos la decisión y vamos a darle para adelanta, hasta donde tope", explicó Cristian. El hermano de Juan Carlos Sauceda reveló que la Fiscalía aceptó los videos; sin embargo, señaló que "los iban a tomar como manipulados; o sea, no iban a tener ninguna veracidad en el caso". Te podría interesar Además de lo anterior, las autoridades le pidieron a la familia del rapero no hacer públicos los videos en cuestión, sin mayor explicación. "Esos vatos (de la Fiscalía) me dijeron que no contaban con los recursos para (analizar) los videos. A mí me dijeron, 'no digas nada', pero no me voy a quedar callado, es mi hermano y a mí me duele", agregó. Por otra parte, Cristian dio a conocer que él recuperó una de las balas que atravesó a su hermano, así como la gorra de quien señalan como el presunto asesino de Lefty. "Una de las balas que atravesó a mi carnal, yo la hallé. Yo fui y me metí a la casa de mi carnal. La bala yo la agarré, la junté con una bolsa y se la entregué al policía que andaba ahí. Mirando los videos, nos dimos cuenta de que vuela una gorra, era de uno de los vatos que andaba ahí", añadió. ¿Quién asesinó al rapero Lefty? La familia de Juan Carlos Sauceda señala como su presunto asesino a Luis Mario Placencia, quien supuestamente entró al domicilio del rapero, junto con dos sujetos más, en Zapopan, Jalisco, el pasado 2 de septiembre. De acuerdo con Imagen Noticias, ni con los videos e identidad del supuesto homicida de Lefty SM, la Fiscalía de Jalisco ha dado avances de la investigación a la familia, por ello están ofreciendo 300 mil pesos de recompensa a quien dé información para localizar a Luis Mario Placencia, quien habría disparado directamente contra el rapero.
